item.title: 1 The dangers of success, the agony of the ego, and the gate of heaven
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 1 The dangers of success, the agony of the ego, and the gate of heaven 29 January 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle IT IS BETTER TO LEAVE A VESSEL UNFILLED, THAN TO ATTEMPT TO CARRY IT WHEN IT IS FULL. IF YOU KEEP FEELING A POINT THAT HAS BEEN SHARPENED, THE POINT CANNOT LONG PRESERVE ITS SHARPNESS. WHEN GOLD AND JADE FILL THE HALL, THEIR POSSESSOR CANNOT KEEP THEM SAFE.

item.title: 10 The invisible, inaudible and intangible Tao
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 10 The invisible, inaudible and intangible Tao 15 April 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle LOOKED AT, BUT CANNOT BE SEEN – THAT IS CALLED THE INVISIBLE (YI). LISTENED TO, BUT CANNOT BE HEARD – THAT IS CALLED THE INAUDIBLE (HSI). GRASPED AT, BUT CANNOT BE TOUCHED – THAT IS CALLED THE INTANGIBLE (WEI). THESE THREE ELUDE ALL OUR INQUIRIES AND HENCE BLEND AND BECOME ONE.

item.title: 11 The image of the eternal and the formless, the ancient and the void
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 11 The image of the eternal and the formless, the ancient and the void 16 April 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle NEITHER BY ITS RISING IS THERE LIGHT, NOR BY ITS SINKING IS THERE DARKNESS. UNCEASING, CONTINUOUS, IT CANNOT BE DEFINED. IT REVERTS AGAIN TO THE REALM OF NOTHINGNESS. THAT IS WHY IT IS CALLED THE FORM OF THE FORMLESS; THE IMAGE OF NOTHINGNESS.

item.title: 12 The signs of a saint: he is alert and irresolute, egoless and playful
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 12 The signs of a saint: he is alert and irresolute, egoless and playful 17 April 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle THE SKILFUL MASTERS (OF THE TAO) IN OLD TIMES, WITH A SUBTLE AND EXQUISITE PENETRATION, COMPREHENDED ITS MYSTERIES, WHICH WERE SO DEEP THAT THEY ELUDED MAN’S KNOWLEDGE. AS THEY WERE THUS BEYOND MAN’S KNOWLEDGE, I WILL MAKE AN EFFORT TO DESCRIBE OF WHAT THEY APPEARED TO BE.

item.title: 13 From repose to equality. to attain liberation through the golden mean
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 13 From repose to equality. to attain liberation through the golden mean 18 April 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle WHO CAN REPOSE IN A MUDDY WORLD? BY LYING STILL IT BECOMES CLEAR. WHO CAN MAINTAIN HIS CALM FOR LONG? BY ACTIVITY, REST COMES BACK TO LIFE. HE WHO EMBRACES THIS TAO GUARDS AGAINST BEING OVERFULL. BECAUSE HE GUARDS AGAINST BEING OVERFULL, HE IS BEYOND WEARING OUT AND RENEWAL.

item.title: 14 The impartial awaiting, the death of pride and the one in the many
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 14 The impartial awaiting, the death of pride and the one in the many 19 April 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle Question 1 FOR THE LAST TWELVE YEARS I HAVE BEEN WAITING FOR THE WATERS OF MY MIND TO CLEAR, BUT THE CARTS OF SITUATIONS AND SURROUNDINGS KEEP PASSING THROUGH THEM CONSTANTLY. THIS WILL GO ON THROUGHOUT LIFE. SHOULD I STILL KEEP WAITING?

item.title: 15 Inaction, destiny and going back to the eternal law
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 15 Inaction, destiny and going back to the eternal law 15 June 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle ATTAIN THE UTMOST IN PASSIVITY. HOLD FIRM TO THE BASIS OF QUIETUDE. MYRIAD THINGS TAKE SHAPE AND RISE TO ACTIVITY, BUT I WATCH THEM FALL BACK TO THEIR REPOSE LIKE VEGETATION THAT LUXURIOUSLY GROWS BUT RETURNS TO THE ROOT (SOIL) FROM WHICH IT SPRINGS.

item.title: 16 The door of Tao \-- forbearance and non-prejudice
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 16 The door of Tao – forbearance and non-prejudice 16 June 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle HE WHO KNOWS THE ETERNAL LAW IS TOLERANT. BEING TOLERANT, HE IS IMPARTIAL. BEING IMPARTIAL, HE IS KINGLY. BEING KINGLY, HE IS IN ACCORD WITH NATURE. BEING IN ACCORD WITH NATURE, HE IS IN ACCORD WITH TAO. BEING IN ACCORD WITH TAO, HE IS ETERNAL AND HIS WHOLE LIFE IS PRESERVED FROM HARM.

item.title: 17 Who is the best ruler? \-- he who is like god
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 17 Who is the best ruler? – he who is like god 17 June 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle OF THE BEST RULERS THE PEOPLE DO NOT KNOW THAT THEY EXIST. THE NEXT BEST THEY LOVE AND PRAISE. THE NEXT THEY FEAR. AND THE NEXT THEY REVILE. WHEN THEY DO NOT COMMAND THE PEOPLE’S FAITH, SOME WILL LOSE FAITH IN THEM,

item.title: 18 The birth of doctrines from the decline of Tao
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 18 The birth of doctrines from the decline of Tao 18 June 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle ON THE DECLINE OF THE GREAT TAO, THE DOCTRINES OF HUMANITY AND JUSTICE AROSE. WHEN KNOWLEDGE AND CLEVERNESS APPEARED, GREAT HYPOCRISY FOLLOWED IN ITS WAKE. WHEN THE SIX RELATIONSHIPS NO LONGER LIVED AT PEACE, THERE WAS (PRAISE OF) ‘KIND PARENTS’ AND ‘FILIAL SONS’. WHEN A COUNTRY FELL INTO CHAOS AND MISRULE,

item.title: 19 To live in artless spontaneity and not in doctrines and decorum
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 19 To live in artless spontaneity and not in doctrines and decorum 19 June 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle BANISH WISDOM, DISCARD KNOWLEDGE, AND THE PEOPLE SHALL PROFIT A HUNDRED FOLD; BANISH ‘HUMANITY’, DISCARD ‘JUSTICE’, AND THE PEOPLE SHALL RECOVER LOVE OF THEIR KIN; BANISH CUNNING, DISCARD ‘UTILITY’, AND THE THIEVES AND BRIGANDS SHALL DISAPPEAR. The greatest difficulty in understanding Lao Tzu is our level of thinking.

item.title: 2 The oneness of the body and the soul, the eternal state of Tao, and the sadhana of the vital breath
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 2 The oneness of the body and the soul, the eternal state of Tao, and the sadhana of the vital breath 30 January 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle WHEN THE INTELLIGENT SOUL AND THE ANIMAL SOUL ARE HELD TOGETHER IN ONE EMBRACE, THEY CAN BE KEPT FROM SEPARATING. WHEN ONE GIVES UNDIVIDED ATTENTION TO THE (VITAL) BREATH AND BRINGS IT TO THE UTMOST DEGREE OF FLEXIBILITY, HE CAN BECOME LIKE A (TENDER) BABE.

item.title: 20 The renunciation of spiritual desires the revelation of the simple self
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 20 The renunciation of spiritual desires the revelation of the simple self 20 June 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle AS THESE TOUCH THE EXTERNALS AND ARE INADEQUATE, THE PEOPLE HAVE NEED OF WHAT THEY CAN DEPEND UPON. REVEAL THY SIMPLE SELF, EMBRACE THY ORIGINAL NATURE, CHECK THY SELFISHNESS, CURTAIL THY DESIRES. To discard wisdom and knowledge, humanity and justice, cunning and utility, is the negation.

item.title: 21 Religion is to be your own self
item.description: < Previous | Contents ‌CHAPTER 21 Religion is to be your own self 21 June 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle Question 1 ONE FRIEND HAS ASKED: IS IT NOT NECESSARY TO RUN IN ORDER TO STOP? It is necessary. But you are running already. You have run enough. There is a long history of previous births behind you where you have been running. You are the result of this. Now it is no longer necessary to run; now it is necessary to stop.

item.title: 3 An aimless life, an inviting attitude and a pliable understanding
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 3 An aimless life, an inviting attitude and a pliable understanding 31 January 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle IN LOVING THE PEOPLE AND RULING THE STATE, CANNOT HE PROCEED WITHOUT ANY (PURPOSE) OF ACTION? IN OPENING AND SHUTTING HIS GATES OF HEAVEN, CANNOT HE DO SO LIKE A FEMALE BIRD? WHILE HIS INTELLIGENCE REACHES IN EVERY DIRECTION, CANNOT HE (APPEAR TO) BE WITHOUT KNOWLEDGE?

item.title: 4 Tao\'s unpresent presence
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 4 Tao’s unpresent presence 1 February 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle THE TAO PRODUCES ALL THINGS AND NOURISHES THEM; IT PRODUCES THEM AND DOES NOT CLAIM THEM AS ITS OWN. IT DOES ALL, AND YET DOES NOT BOAST OF IT. IT PRESIDES OVER ALL, AND YET DOES NOT CONTROL THEM. THIS IS WHAT IS CALLED THE MYSTERIOUS QUALITY OF THE TAO.

item.title: 5 Non-existence and emptiness is the support of everything
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 5 Non-existence and emptiness is the support of everything 2 February 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle THE THIRTY SPOKES UNITE THE ONE NAME; BUT IT IS ON THE AXLE THAT THE USE OF THE WHEEL DEPENDS. CLAY IS FASHIONED INTO VESSELS; BUT IT IS ON THEIR EMPTY HOLLOWNESS THAT THEIR USE DEPENDS. THE DOORS AND WINDOWS ARE CUT OUT FROM THE WALLS TO FORM AN APARTMENT; BUT IT IS ON THE EMPTY SPACE WITHIN, THAT ITS USE DEPENDS.

item.title: 6 Not the hunger of the senses be concerned with the hunger of the spirit
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 6 Not the hunger of the senses be concerned with the hunger of the spirit 3 February 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle COLOUR’S FIVE HUES, FROM THE EYES THEIR SIGHT WILL TAKE MUSIC’S FIVE NOTES, THE EARS AS DEAF CAN MAKE. THE FIVE FLAVOURS DEPRIVE THE MOUTH OF TASTE. THE CHARIOT COURSE, AND THE WILD HUNTING WASTE MAKE MAD THE MIND; AND OBJECTS RARE AND STRANGE.

item.title: 7 The sadhana of Tao \-- in the context of yoga
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 7 The sadhana of Tao – in the context of yoga 4 February 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle Question 1 ONE FRIEND HAS ASKED: “YOGA IS A PATH OF ELEVATION, OF RAISING THE LIFE-ENERGY UPWARDS, WHEREAS LAO TZU’S METHOD IS EXACTLY THE OPPOSITE: OF BRINGING DOWN THE ENERGY TO THE NAVEL CENTRE. SO THE QUESTION INVARIABLY RISES: WHICH IS THE RIGHT METHOD?

item.title: 8 Two sides of the same coin: honour and dishonour, greed and fear
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 8 Two sides of the same coin: honour and dishonour, greed and fear 13 April 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle “FAVOUR AND DISGRACE CAUSE ONE DISMAY, WHAT WE VALUE AND WHAT WE FEAR ARE AS IF WITHIN THE SELF.” WHAT IS MEANT BY SPEAKING THUS OF FAVOUR AND DISGRACE? DISGRACE IS BEING IN A LOW POSITION (AFTER THE ENJOYMENT OF FAVOUR).

item.title: 9 Only he is fit to be the master whose ego is naught
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 9 Only he is fit to be the master whose ego is naught 14 April 1972 pm in Immortal Study Circle WHAT DOES IT MEAN TO SAY THAT WHAT WE VALUE AND WHAT WE FEAR ARE WITHIN THE SELF? WE HAVE FEAR BECAUSE WE HAVE A SELF. WHEN WE DO NOT REGARD THAT SELF AS THE SELF, WHAT HAVE WE TO FEAR?
